intro: Polycarpaea billei, commonly known as the Billei's polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
